# Sex differences
Verteilung der Daten im Anhang. Im Text werde nennen.
<br />
* two-sample, two-sided, unpaired T-test
<br />
Women lost on average of 2.44 cm in height and men 20.03 cm. Women lost significantly more height than men (p<0.0001).
Relativly lost women on average 1.54 % of height and men 1.18 %  (p<0.0001)

# Analysis

* Alle Modelle sind mit dem relativem heightloss gerechnet. Die Unterschiede zum absoluten heightloss sind nicht stark, aber relative macht für mich mehr Sinn und können wir besser kommunizieren.


# Association between height in childhood and height loss at age 69

Lineare Regression

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width = '100%', fig.cap="Figure 1: Coefficients of the linear regression models to estimate the effect of relative heightloss on different height parameters during childhood and age 36. Adjusted for excess weight, education, socialclass, smoking, fruits and exercise"}
include_graphics("../../Analysis/output/Figure1_rel.png")
```


# Association between height loss and health in later life

* GAM Models
* rel heightloss and SITAR height included as smoothing term
* SITAR tempo and velocity linear behavior -> fixed term
* Um die Ergebnisse der Modelle vergleichen zu können, muss in Model 1 - 3 die gleiche Sample Size sein. Wenn man für jedes Model eine andere Sample Size nimmt, sind diese eigentlich nicht ganz vergleichbar. 
* health.score.sum N: male : 509, female: 566
* chronicDiseaseScore N: male : 532, female: 584
* osteo N: male: 534, female: 584
* pain to walk N: male: 531, female: 577


```{r echo=FALSE, out.width = '100%', fig.cap="Figure 2: Logistical GAM Models of health in later life and  heightloss of males.Model 1: univariate (only relative heightloss), Model 2: multivariate: heightloss,SITAR_size_height,SITAR_size_tempo,SITAR_size_velocity,Excess.weight,region and education, Model 3:multivariate paramters as in Model 2 + smoking, fruits and exercise"}
include_graphics("../../Analysis/output/Figure_male_loss.png")
```

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width = '100%', fig.cap="Figure 3: Logistical GAM Models of health in later life and  heightloss of males.Model 1: univariate (only relative heightloss), Model 2: multivariate: heightloss,SITAR_size_height,SITAR_size_tempo,SITAR_size_velocity,Excess.weight,region and education, Model 3:multivariate paramters as in Model 2 + smoking, fruits and exercise"}
include_graphics("../../Analysis/output/Figure_female_loss.png")
```
